material.mattext: Note that the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval has been edited out. Which of the following is the number that has been edited out?

Incorrect. Note that since the p-value is .09, at the .05 significance level, Ho cannot be rejected. Recall that this means that the null value, 12.5, is a plausible value for the population, and, therefore, must be included in the 95% confidence interval. 12.375 leaves 12.5 out of the confidence interval.

Good Job! Indeed, since based on the p-value we cannot reject Ho at the .05 significance level, the 95% confidence interval must include 12.5 as a plausible value. Also the sample mean 12.008 is exactly the mid point between 11.439 (the lower limit of the confidence interval) and 12.577 as it should be.

Incorrect. Based on the p-value we cannot reject Ho at the .05 significance level, and, therefore, the confidence interval must include 12.5 as a plausible value. While it is true that 13.439 "does this job", and cannot be the upper limit of the confidence interval since the sample mean, 12.008 is not the mid point of the confidence interval as it should be.
